author: Natalia Drozdiak, John Bowker, Ramsey Al-Rikabi
description: While President Donald Trump weighs whether to join Israel’s assault on Iran, foreign policy veterans and analysts argue that a negotiated settlement, not bombs nor commandos, is the only way to eliminate the threat of Tehran gaining a nuclear weapon.
title: Deal, Not Bombs, Seen as Only Way to End Iranian Nuclear Threat

author: Chaimae Chouiekh
description: Canada’s House of Commons cleared a bill to accelerate the building of major projects such as pipelines, but Indigenous groups are threatening to force a legal battle over it.
title: Carney Bill to Speed Projects Passes Vote Despite Indigenous Opposition

author: Akayla Gardner
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Keeps the World Waiting With Deadlines and Deferrals

author: David Gura, K Oanh Ha, Rachael Lewis-Krisky
description: On today’s Big Take podcast: How President Trump’s “American First” policies have kept international tourists away, forecasted to cost the US travel industry billions.
title: America the Avoidable: Why Trump’s Policies Could Cost US Tourism Billions

author: Pierre Paulden
description: President Donald Trump said his administration has been working closely with Harvard University and may announce a deal over the next week, potentially ending a standoff between the White House and the richest and oldest US university.
title: Harvard May Strike ‘Mindbogglingly’ Historic US Deal, Trump Says

author: Suzanne Lynch, Alberto Nardelli, Andrea Palasciano
description: A report commissioned by the European Union found that Israel may have broken the humanitarian terms of the accord that dictates their bilateral relations.
title: EU Finds Israel May Have Broken Human Rights Terms in Accord

author: Jim Wyss, Eric Martin
description: Amid pressure from Washington to resolve the crisis in Haiti, the new head of the Western Hemisphere’s top multilateral organization pledged to work with the United Nations and international donors to chart a roadmap for peace in the violence-torn island nation.
title: Under New Leadership, OAS Is Determined to Show Progress on Haiti

author: David Voreacos, Anika Arora Seth
description: A federal judge issued a new order that will allow Harvard University to continue enrolling foreign students while the school fights to overturn President Donald Trump’s proclamation barring their entry.
title: Harvard Granted Longer Reprieve From Trump’s Foreign Student Ban

author: Natalie Lung
description: New York City on Friday announced new minimum-pay rules for rideshare drivers, settling on a smaller-than-proposed 5% increase following pushback from Uber Technologies Inc. and Lyft Inc.
title: NYC Sets Smaller Driver Pay Bump After Uber, Lyft Pushback

author: James Herron
description: The global oil market so far does not call for any additional steps from producers amid the conflict between Israel and Iran as the tensions have had only a limited effect on prices, according to Russia’s President Vladimir Putin.
title: No Urgent Need for Key Producers to Aid Oil Market, Putin Says

description: NEW YORK (AP) — A federal judge on Friday ordered the U.S. government to free former Columbia University graduate student Mahmoud Khalil from the immigration detention center where he has been held since early March while the Trump administration sought to deport him over his role in pro-Palestinian protests.
title: Judge Says He Will Order Ex-Columbia Student Khalil Freed From Detention

author: Ellen Milligan
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer will be relieved by US President Donald Trump’s move to delay a decision for now on striking Iran, giving the British leader more time to address the vexing issue of providing military support.
title: Why a Remote UK Base Makes the US-Iran Standoff So Difficult for Starmer

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The US escalated pressure on Iran with sanctions targeting individuals and companies allegedly involved in obtaining machinery for its defense industry, as well as those backing a militant group with ties to the regime.
title: US Sanctions Target Iran Defense Industry, Houthis

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: NATO allies are pressing Spain to end its holdout on a stepped-up defense spending target that’s one of US President Donald Trump’s key demands for an alliance summit next week.
title: NATO Allies Seek to Sway Spain Toward Trump-Led Spending Target

author: Anthony Halpin
description: President Vladimir Putin said Russia sought and received assurances from Israel and the US that they’d ensure the safety of Russian staff working at Iran’s nuclear power plant at Bushehr.
title: Russia Says Israel, US Pledge Staff Safety at Iran Nuclear Plant

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court refused to put a challenge to President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs on an ultra-fast track.
title: Supreme Court Refuses to Expedite Challenge to Trump’s Tariffs

author: Anthony Halpin
description: President Vladimir Putin said he isn’t seeking Ukraine’s “capitulation” as a way to end the war, even as he reiterated his claim that the two countries are one people.
title: Putin Says He Isn’t Seeking Ukraine’s ‘Capitulation’ to End War

author: Clara Hernanz Lizarraga
description: Indra Sistemas SA’s chairman sought to assuage doubts over Europe’s next-generation fighter-jet program, after disagreements between partners Dassault Aviation SA and Airbus SE broke into the open this week.
title: Spain’s Indra Downplays Franco-German Sparring Over Fighter Jet

author: Magdalena Del Valle, Golnar Motevalli
description: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres called for a return to negotiations to resolve the conflict between Israel and Iran, warning that the world is “on course to potential chaos” if it expands.
title: UN Chief Calls for Diplomacy as Israel-Iran War Rages

author: Dana Wollman, Catherine Lucey
description: Shares of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. and other chipmakers slid on Friday after the Wall Street Journal reported that the Trump administration is considering further restrictions on China.
title: Chip Stocks Slide on Report of New Possible Limits on China

author: Lucy White
description: The UK’s House of Commons voted to legalize assisted dying on Friday, in a move that is likely to usher in a significant cultural shift over how to handle the treatment of those with terminal illnesses.
title: UK House of Commons Approves Legalization of Assisted Dying

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Switzerland is lifting economic sanctions on Syria, following an European Union decision to the same end.
title: Switzerland Follows European Union in Lifting Sanctions on Syria

author: Alisa Odenheimer, Eltaf Najafizada, Akayla Gardner, Samy Adghirni
description: Talks aimed at de-escalating the week-long war between Israel and Iran got under way in Geneva on Friday after US President Donald Trump signaled he would give diplomacy a chance before deciding whether to intervene militarily.
title: European Nations Lead Push for De-Escalation in Israel-Iran War

author: Michael Nienaber, Suzanne Lynch, Kamil Kowalcze
description: The European Union shelved a plan for a stricter price cap on Russian oil exports over concerns that the US won’t back tougher sanctions due to rising crude prices.
title: EU Abandons Proposal to Lower Price Cap on Russian Oil to $45

author: Mishal Husain
description: Winnie Byanyima says her organization has lost almost 50% of its funding, a gap that is undermining global efforts to combat HIV/AIDS.
title: UNAIDS Executive Director: ‘The HIV Response Is in Crisis’

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Switzerland plans to invest more than $300 million to help international organizations in Geneva stay afloat after cuts in financing for multilateralism led by the US.
title: Switzerland Pumps $300 Million Into Geneva to Offset US Aid Cuts

author: Alex Longley
description: Close to 1,000 ships a day are seeing their GPS signals jammed near Iran’s coast, according to a French naval liaison group.
title: Nearly 1,000 Ships’ GPS Jammed Near Iran Daily, Navy Group Says

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright, Levin Stamm
description: The Swiss government is seeking closer collaboration with other European nations in defense procurement, following warnings by senior officials over the country’s struggling arms industry.
title: Swiss Seek European Arms Procurement Ties to Bolster Defense

author: Erik Wasson
description: The Senate rules-keeper has decided that Republicans can’t use President Donald Trump’s multi-trillion dollar tax bill to strip all funding from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and to cut salaries for many Federal Reserve employees.
title: Cuts to Fed Staff Pay, CFPB Funds Blocked from Trump Tax Bill

author: Agnieszka Barteczko
description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk has called for a partial vote recount of the country’s presidential election amid alleged irregularities.
title: Poland’s Tusk Calls for Partial Recount of Presidential Ballot

author: S'thembile Cele
description: A controversial South African politician, previously criticized by US President Donald Trump, was denied entry to the UK on the grounds that he had aired extremist views, including support for Iran-backed Hamas and Hezbollah.
title: UK Denies Entry to South African Politician Over Extremist Views

author: Laura Nahmias
description: For the full experience visit: NYC's Zohran Mamdani Tries Selling Socialism to the Home of Wall Street
title: NYC's Zohran Mamdani Tries Selling Socialism to the Home of Wall Street

author: Andra Timu
description: Romania’s president plans to designate Liberal Party leader Ilie Bolojan as prime minister after negotiators reached an agreement to form a new government to tackle the country’s fiscal deficit. The currency rebounded.
title: Romanian President to Name Premier as Fiscal Deal Reached

author: Ellen Milligan
description: The UK will conduct a full review of security at its biggest airbase after a pro-Palestine activist group posted a video on X claiming to have damaged two military aircraft there.
title: UK Launches Security Review Over Vandalized Military Jets

author: Katarina Hoije
description: Niger’s military government took control of Orano SA’s uranium mine, escalating a standoff with the French nuclear-power company.
title: Niger Junta Seizes French Nuclear Giant Orano’s Uranium Mine

author: Philip Heijmans
description: Paetongtarn Shinawatra lost her second-biggest coalition partner this week, leaving her with a razor-thin majority
title: Thai Premier Has Few Options and Fewer Allies

author: Andra Timu
description: Romanian leaders hit a last-minute snag in talks to form a new government as negotiators deadlocked over how to narrow the Balkan nation’s budget deficit. The currency fell.
title: Romania Government Talks Hit Roadblock Over Fiscal Measures

author: Laura Dhillon Kane, Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: The relationship between Canada and India had been strained since the Trudeau government accused New Delhi’s diplomats of backing violence and harassment against Sikh separatists living in the North American country. The dispute led to tit-for-tat expulsions of diplomatic officials.
title: What’s Next for Canada-India Ties After G-7 Reset

author: Ondiro Oganga
description: Rwandan authorities have arrested opposition leader Victoire Ingabire over an alleged plot to incite public disorder.
title: Rwanda Arrests Opposition Leader Over Alleged Incitement Plot

author: Francesca Stevens, Nguyen Dieu Tu Uyen
description: Vietnam’s Communist Party chief To Lam is preparing to travel to the US in coming weeks as the two sides look to clinch a trade deal before President Donald Trump’s higher tariffs kick in, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Vietnam’s Top Leader Plans US Trip as Tariff Deadline Looms

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan is planning to cut the issuance of super-long bonds this year by more than earlier reported, after record levels of volatility in super-long yields in recent months stoked market concerns.
title: Japan Set to Cut Super-Long Bond Issuance by More Than Expected

author: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal
description: The popular Substacker returns home to China.
title: Zichen Wang's Exit Interview From America

author: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal
description: Zichen Wang is the writer of the Pekingnology newsletter, which translates important speeches and articles from China into English, and contextualizes them for Western readers. Over the past year, he’s been a master’s degree student at Princeton University, although he’s recently returned home to resume his career at a think tank in China. His stint in the US obviously came at a very interesting time, both due to the rising US-China tensions, and also the growing restrictions on Chinese students
title: Odd Lots: Zichen Wang’s Exit Interview from America (Podcast)

author: Lucy White
description: The UK’s House of Commons will hold a final vote on Friday on whether to allow assisted dying, a move that could usher in a significant cultural shift over how to handle those with terminal illnesses.
title: UK Lawmakers Set Final Vote on Legalization of Assisted Dying

author: Beril Akman
description: A Turkish court arrested a lawyer of jailed Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu, intensifying a widespread crackdown on the opposition.
title: Turkey Arrests Jailed Erdogan Rival’s Lawyer, Widening Crackdown

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra visited troops at a border post to ease public backlash over her criticism of the army in a leaked phone call, as pro-royalist groups threatened to intensify protests demanding her resignation.
title: Thai PM Visits Troops as Rivals Plan New Protests for Her Ouster

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: The cities of Odesa and Kharkiv were hit by massive Russian drone attacks overnight as Moscow continues its daily air attacks against Ukraine.
title: Russian Overnight Drone Barrage Hits Ukraine’s Kharkiv and Odesa

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra is fighting to hold on to power less than a year since taking office, after leaked comments critical of the military triggered a political crisis.
title: How Thai Political Crisis May Unfold as PM Fights to Keep Job

author: Qianwei Zhang
description: China’s coast guard said it drove away a Philippine ship around Scarborough Shoal in the South China Sea on Friday.
title: China Says It Drove Away Philippine Ship From Disputed Shoal

author: Tom Rees
description: UK retail sales plummeted in May, the first time they have fallen this year, in a sharp reversal that suggests the economy could be struggling in the second quarter.
title: UK Retail Sales Plunge 2.7% in Worrying Sign for Economic Growth

author: Jorge Valero
description: The European Union will restrict the ability for Chinese medical device manufacturers to access public procurement contracts worth more than €5 million ($5.7 million).
title: EU to Restrict China’s Access to Medical Device Procurements

author: Akayla Gardner, Alisa Odenheimer, Eltaf Najafizada
description: President Donald Trump will decide within two weeks whether to strike Iran, his spokeswoman said, as Israel hit more Iranian nuclear sites and warned its attacks may bring down the leadership in Tehran.
title: Trump Signals He’ll Hold Off Iran Strike to Give Diplomacy Time

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand’s most prominent political dynasty is on the brink of losing power once again. Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra is facing street protests and growing calls to resign amid mounting anger over a leaked phone call with former Cambodian leader Hun Sen, in which she criticized the Thai army for its role in a border dispute with the neighboring country.
title: Why Thailand’s Ruling Political Clan Faces a New Threat

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: The problems piling up for Primer Minister Pedro Sanchez in Spain are threatening to spill into next week’s NATO summit, with potentially drastic consequences for the rest of the European Union.
title: Sanchez Is Putting NATO’s Trump Plan at Risk by Opposing 5% Goal

author: Yian Lee
description: China sent the most warplanes toward Taiwan since October, a move that follows US lawmakers visiting a top military figure and both the UK and Japan sailing warships through the strait separating the island from the Chinese mainland.
title: China Sends Warplanes Near Taiwan After US Lawmakers’ Visit

author: Suttinee Yuvejwattana, Claire Jiao
description: Thailand’s sudden descent into a new political crisis threatens an economy that’s already on the brink of a technical recession and bracing for the impact of the global trade war.
title: Political Woes Threaten to Sink Thai Economy Deeper Into Malaise

author: Madlin Mekelburg
description: President Donald Trump can continue to use National Guard troops to respond to protests in Los Angeles as a legal challenge over his use of the military proceeds, a federal appeals court ruled.
title: Trump Can Keep Using Troops in LA for Now, Appeals Court Says

author: Kok Leong Chan, Anisah Shukry
description: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak succeeded in setting aside another one of his court cases involving troubled state fund 1MDB, in a rare victory for the jailed politician.
title: Malaysia Court Discharges Najib From One of His 1MDB Cases

author: Ruth Carson
description: Financial markets have seen the worst of Donald Trump’s tariff threats, helping make midcap stocks an attractive buy as the outlook improves, according to a Fidelity International money manager.
title: Fidelity Fund Bets on Midcaps Saying Worst of Tariffs Is Over
